title.narrative: Child protection for internally displaced people in South Sudan

description.narrative: Dutch Relief Alliance South Sudan Phase II response (LWF)

Protection is affecting most displaced people (estimated 90%), including large numbers of unaccompanied and separated children. Host communities are also affected. ICCO and LWF selected Maban area for the protection component of the program both since the needs are high due to influx of internally displaced people (IDPs). Due to limited protection activities for IDPs and the host communities in Maban county, many children are working in the markets, oil fields, government sorghum plantation, hotels and there are cases of sexual exploitation. There is also general insecurity and militarization of the local population which causes fear and uncertainty. Limited government and community based structures capacities to handle CP concerns e.g. Police, judiciary and prisons. There are very limited education opportunities in the host communities which has exposed children to protection risks.
General Protection Concerns in Maban County include: • Inadequate protection activities in the host communities • Many children working in the markets, oil fields, government sorghum plantation, hotels and there are cases of sexual exploitation • General insecurity and militarisation of the local population causes fear and uncertainty • Limited government capacities to handle CP concerns e.g. Police • Inadequate capacities of the community based structures • Inadequate shelters for the IDPs
The project targets 10.000 children and 2,090 people with protection and psycho-social support activities through the renovation of 4 Child-Friendly Spaces (CFS) and the construction of additional 4 new Child Friendly Spaces. 400 traumatized children will receive psycho-social services. Other activities include facilitation of play activities, community awareness campaigns on child protection and a back-to-learning initiative to increase enrolment and retention of children, recruitment of staff, establishment of child protection committees and facilitation of the day of African child and international child day.

This project is focused on increased protection for vulnerable and at risk children among internally displaced people (IDPs)/ host communities in Maban, South Sudan. The project targets 10.000 children and 2,090 people; they are provided with protection and psycho-social support activities. The project is carried out by ACT Alliance partner Lutheran World Federation.
